result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *See conditions as stated in the VIP Program Assessment and Recommendations

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed with Prejudice
*Reason:  Defendant has complied with all requirements of the VIP

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Emory Servey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from JusticeWorks dated 02/21/17 in re:  request to successfully discharge defendant from VIP Program effective immediately

Defendant Joel Emory Servey in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:05 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Knaapen provides a copy of the VIP recommendations to the Court.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count 2 is DRI.  Clerk directed to withhold entry Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
VIP Program for 6 months -
20 hrs community service
Participate in group and day reporting at the discretion of the case manager 
Sign appropriate releases for case manager 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the case manager
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
**If defendant successfully completes the VIP Program then case would be amended to a county ordinance with a $50 fine plus costs.

Count 2 - DRI

ADDRESS INFO for Joel Emory Servey
Current: 1601 Riverview Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 06-29-2016)
Prior: 2222 College Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant Joel Emory Servey in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.

GUILTY plea entered.
Court questions the defendant re: plea and waiver of counsel. 
Defendant withdraws the guilty plea. 

Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on defendant's behalf. 

State recommends a signature bond with conditions as stated.  Makes additional statements to the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.
